pageContext.claim: “Finding new cures for childhood cancer and ending the AIDS epidemic in America in less than 10 years, we're doing that. Who would have believed we could do that? We're doing that. And the previous administration spent no money on that and we're spending a lot but think of that.”
pageContext.analysis: Trump falsely suggests the Obama administration did not fight against the AIDS epidemic.  But it spent more than $3.5 billion per year on research and prevention to combat HIV/AIDS, launched a comprehensive national strategy on combating HIV/AIDS and through the Affordable Care Act made it possible for HIV/AIDS patients to obtain health insurance.
